position.marginalia_text: et a natura sui mundati, tingentis illud s[cilicet] Argentum viuum. Item, idem Geber dicit de sole. Aurum est praeciosissimu[m] metalloru[m], et est tinctura rubedinis, quia tingit, transformat, et illuminat omne corpus, quoniam alumen est, et tinctura vera, et perfectio totius operis diuini, quod Deus electis suis largitur, et non alijs, cui sit honor Laus & Gloria. marginalia.translation: And his were cleaned from nature, tingeing that substance, that is, quicksilver. Also, Gebers says the same bout the son: Gold is the most precious of the metals and is a tincture of redness, because it colours, transforms and illuminates the entire body, because it is alum and a true tincutre and perfection off the entire divine work that God granted his chosen people and no others, to whom be praise and glory.
